18#include "HybridBinarizer.h"
19#include "LuminanceSource.h"
20#include "ByteArray.h"
21#include "BitMatrix.h"
22#include "Matrix.h"
23#include "ZXNumeric.h"
24#include "ZXContainerAlgorithms.h"
25
26#include <cassert>
27#include <cstdint>
28#include <functional>
29#include <memory>
30#include <mutex>
31#include <vector>
32#include <utility>
33
34namespace ZXing {
35
36// This class uses 5x5 blocks to compute local luminance, where each block is 8x8 pixels.
37// So this is the smallest dimension in each axis we can accept.
38static const int BLOCK_SIZE = 8;
39static const int MINIMUM_DIMENSION = BLOCK_SIZE * 5;
40static const int MIN_DYNAMIC_RANGE = 24;
41
42struct HybridBinarizer::DataCache
43{
44 std::once_flag once;
45 std::shared_ptr<const BitMatrix> matrix;
46};
47
48HybridBinarizer::HybridBinarizer(const std::shared_ptr<const LuminanceSource>& source) :
49 GlobalHistogramBinarizer(source),
50 _cache(new DataCache)
51{
52}
53
54HybridBinarizer::~HybridBinarizer() = default;
55
56/**
57* Calculates a single black point for each block of pixels and saves it away.
58* See the following thread for a discussion of this algorithm:
59* http://groups.google.com/group/zxing/browse_thread/thread/d06efa2c35a7ddc0
60*/
61static Matrix<int> CalculateBlackPoints(const uint8_t* luminances, int subWidth, int subHeight, int width, int height, int stride)
62{
63 Matrix<int> blackPoints(subWidth, subHeight);
64
65 for (int y = 0; y < subHeight; y++) {
66 int yoffset = std::min(y * BLOCK_SIZE, height - BLOCK_SIZE);
67 for (int x = 0; x < subWidth; x++) {
68 int xoffset = std::min(x * BLOCK_SIZE, width - BLOCK_SIZE);
69 int sum = 0;
70 int min = 0xFF;
71 int max = 0;
72 for (int yy = 0, offset = yoffset * stride + xoffset; yy < BLOCK_SIZE; yy++, offset += stride) {
73 for (int xx = 0; xx < BLOCK_SIZE; xx++) {
74 int pixel = luminances[offset + xx];
75 sum += pixel;
76 // still looking for good contrast
77 if (pixel < min) {
78 min = pixel;
79 }
80 if (pixel > max) {
81 max = pixel;
82 }
83 }
84 // short-circuit min/max tests once dynamic range is met
85 if (max - min > MIN_DYNAMIC_RANGE) {
86 // finish the rest of the rows quickly
87 for (yy++, offset += stride; yy < BLOCK_SIZE; yy++, offset += stride) {
88 for (int xx = 0; xx < BLOCK_SIZE; xx++) {
89 sum += luminances[offset + xx];
90 }
91 }
92 }
93 }
94
95 // The default estimate is the average of the values in the block.
96 int average = sum / (BLOCK_SIZE * BLOCK_SIZE);
97 if (max - min <= MIN_DYNAMIC_RANGE) {
98 // If variation within the block is low, assume this is a block with only light or only
99 // dark pixels. In that case we do not want to use the average, as it would divide this
100 // low contrast area into black and white pixels, essentially creating data out of noise.
101 //
102 // The default assumption is that the block is light/background. Since no estimate for
103 // the level of dark pixels exists locally, use half the min for the block.
104 average = min / 2;
105
106 if (y > 0 && x > 0) {
107 // Correct the "white background" assumption for blocks that have neighbors by comparing
108 // the pixels in this block to the previously calculated black points. This is based on
109 // the fact that dark barcode symbology is always surrounded by some amount of light
110 // background for which reasonable black point estimates were made. The bp estimated at
111 // the boundaries is used for the interior.
112
113 // The (min < bp) is arbitrary but works better than other heuristics that were tried.
114 int averageNeighborBlackPoint =
115 (blackPoints(x, y - 1) + (2 * blackPoints(x - 1, y)) + blackPoints(x - 1, y - 1)) / 4;
116 if (min < averageNeighborBlackPoint) {
117 average = averageNeighborBlackPoint;
118 }
119 }
120 }
121 blackPoints(x, y) = average;
122 }
123 }
124 return blackPoints;
125}
126
127
128/**
129* Applies a single threshold to a block of pixels.
130*/
131static void ThresholdBlock(const uint8_t* luminances, int xoffset, int yoffset, int threshold, int stride, BitMatrix& matrix)
132{
133 for (int y = 0, offset = yoffset * stride + xoffset; y < BLOCK_SIZE; y++, offset += stride) {
134 for (int x = 0; x < BLOCK_SIZE; x++) {
135 // Comparison needs to be <= so that black == 0 pixels are black even if the threshold is 0.
136 if (luminances[offset + x] <= threshold) {
137 matrix.set(xoffset + x, yoffset + y);
138 }
139 }
140 }
141}
142
143/**
144* For each block in the image, calculate the average black point using a 5x5 grid
145* of the blocks around it. Also handles the corner cases (fractional blocks are computed based
146* on the last pixels in the row/column which are also used in the previous block).
147*/
148static void CalculateThresholdForBlock(const uint8_t* luminances, int subWidth, int subHeight, int width, int height,
149 int stride, const Matrix<int>& blackPoints, BitMatrix& matrix)
150{
151 for (int y = 0; y < subHeight; y++) {
152 int yoffset = std::min(y * BLOCK_SIZE, height - BLOCK_SIZE);
153 for (int x = 0; x < subWidth; x++) {
154 int xoffset = std::min(x * BLOCK_SIZE, width - BLOCK_SIZE);
155 int left = Clamp(x, 2, subWidth - 3);
156 int top = Clamp(y, 2, subHeight - 3);
157 int sum = 0;
158 for (int dy = -2; dy <= 2; ++dy) {
159 for (int dx = -2; dx <= 2; ++dx) {
160 sum += blackPoints(left + dx, top + dy);
161 }
162 }
163 int average = sum / 25;
164 ThresholdBlock(luminances, xoffset, yoffset, average, stride, matrix);
165 }
166 }
167}
168
169
170/**
171* Calculates the final BitMatrix once for all requests. This could be called once from the
172* constructor instead, but there are some advantages to doing it lazily, such as making
173* profiling easier, and not doing heavy lifting when callers don't expect it.
174*/
175static void InitBlackMatrix(const LuminanceSource& source, std::shared_ptr<const BitMatrix>& outMatrix)
176{
177 int width = source.width();
178 int height = source.height();
179 ByteArray buffer;
180 int stride;
181 const uint8_t* luminances = source.getMatrix(buffer, stride);
182 int subWidth = (width + BLOCK_SIZE - 1) / BLOCK_SIZE; // ceil(width/BS)
183 int subHeight = (height + BLOCK_SIZE - 1) / BLOCK_SIZE; // ceil(height/BS)
184 auto blackPoints = CalculateBlackPoints(luminances, subWidth, subHeight, width, height, stride);
185
186 auto matrix = std::make_shared<BitMatrix>(width, height);
187 CalculateThresholdForBlock(luminances, subWidth, subHeight, width, height, stride, blackPoints, *matrix);
188 outMatrix = std::move(matrix);
189}
190
191std::shared_ptr<const BitMatrix>
192HybridBinarizer::getBlackMatrix() const
193{
194 int width = _source->width();
195 int height = _source->height();
196 if (width >= MINIMUM_DIMENSION && height >= MINIMUM_DIMENSION) {
197 std::call_once(_cache->once, &InitBlackMatrix, std::cref(*_source), std::ref(_cache->matrix));
198 return _cache->matrix;
199 }
200 else {
201 // If the image is too small, fall back to the global histogram approach.
202 return GlobalHistogramBinarizer::getBlackMatrix();
203 }
204}
205
206std::shared_ptr<BinaryBitmap>
207HybridBinarizer::newInstance(const std::shared_ptr<const LuminanceSource>& source) const
208{
209 return std::make_shared<HybridBinarizer>(source);
210}
211
212} // ZXing
